Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 12:16AM Bermuda77 wrote: I got my diagnosis yesterday.  It was of course at first a shock but I know we can fight this.  We can do all things in Christ who gives us strength.
Posts.Title: Hello kelnied LoriL

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 04:01PM Bermuda77 wrote: You are all so awesome women of God!!!  Reading the post on this thread makes me feel home.  As I was praying this morning -- God put a song in my heart to write and I just want to share with you all: You hold my life on the palm of Your Hand You care for me, You care for me You hold my life on the palm of Your Hand, You died for me, You died for me And I shall never be afraid to thread the path of righteousness Because You're there who gives me strength to conquer battles along the way. You my God is everything You're all I want more than anything The glitters of this world will pass Your love for me will never fade I praise you Lord, my Holy Lord.  You shed your blood and died for me. The life I have was Yours to give and what I do is my gift to you.  WE ARE OVERCOMERS.  -Connie-
Posts.Title: Hello kelnied LoriL

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 05:48PM Bermuda77 wrote: God is an awesome God and nothing is impossible to HIM.  I do believe in miracle and I'm a walking miracle myself.  What the enemy meant for harm God always turns into good.  Each time I overcome with double portions of blessings.  I had a double mastectomy last Monday and spent the night in the hospital.  I have four drains which will most likely come out by next week.  I received good news that the sentinel node is clean, Stage 1 and I will unlikely need chemo.  I never felt afraid through my journey because of the strong presence of God.  Miracles happen everyday. Keep talking to God.  Your wife is so blessed for having a husband like you.  Continue the good work that God has started in you.  You are not alone in this journey.  BE STILL AND KNOW THAT HE IS GOD.
